intro: Baphia mambillensis, commonly known as the African senna, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and often compound leaves. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven leaflets, and it produces yellow to orange flowers that are clustered in racemes. Baphia mambillensis is typically found in moist, forested areas and can grow up to several meters in height. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are often used in traditional medicine due to their potential pharmacological properties.
